reviews.review: Finished the entire game and was satisfied at what i was offered. If you really enjoy good puzzle games, this is the best pick you could choose.

Ótimo jogo, demorei um pouco pra entender a mecânica, ele é bem didático no começo, então depois que entendi fiquei jogando direto (em dias distintos) até terminar, o que levou cerca de 5 horas.
Parece pouco mas são horas muito intensas, o jogo começa mesmo nas últimas câmaras de teste.
No final tem um bolo pra comemorar, lembre-se sempre.
Um clássico. Recomendo.

There's not a whole lot I can say about Portal that hasn't been said by smarter and more interesting people than me. What I can do is write a love letter to a game that made my childhood clever, and gave me a love for storytelling and video games and psychology and god knows what else.

Portal is a game that is simple, and caters to the most basic human instincts of "square peg, square hole" and "pit of acid, do not enter or your skin will boil off". The routine visual and audio mechanisms make a playthrough of Portal a full sensory experience- the experience of being so very, very alone, with nobody coming to save you. But hey, sometimes there's a funny cube, and that makes it all worth it. It is an escape in both a literal and a metaphorical sense; as you make your way to the surface in Portal, you detach a bit from the complicated things surrounding you and can enjoy a bit of primal fear as a rocket turret makes that horrifying trill. (I think I know why they didn't carry that into Portal 2. That sound deals actual psychic damage.) 

Above all, Portal is a biopic, a story about hubris and about those who come after it. Chell and GLaDOS are victims of a strange and unjust place, and even without the context of the sequel or any extraneous lore, there's a fantastic tension between protagonist and antagonist that never ceases to bring chills. Adding in the context brought to the universe by Half Life, Portal 2, Lab Rat, and the animated shorts, you get a fascinating experience every time. I replay this game all the time, only to discover new secrets.

Anyways, I'm considering this my formal apology for pirating the game back when I was 11. 

Play this game. Your life will be better for it.
Вполне не плохая игра про порталы. Лично мне понравилось

Portal is short and simple, but that's what allows it to be perfectly refined in every way imaginable. The portal gun is the ideal tool for a puzzle platformer game and the levels are all designed extremely well around its mechanics. The simple decision to make the portals conserve momentum really takes the gameplay to the next level. Everything is super intuitive; I only got stuck twice and both times I was able to figure it out without way too much trouble.  The game is well optimized for mouse and keyboard controls too. And of course the small story that there is is told so well with the combination of environmental elements and GlaDOS's dialogue throughout the game. At times I took puzzles slower than I needed to so I could hear everything she had to say. With all its elements coming together so ideally I can honestly say this is one of the best games I have ever played.
It's a classic for a reason.

Just a perfect game. I don't care what people say bout its' length or shit. A milestone of gaming, pretty iconic game.
Also the cake is a lie!!

10/10

This game was a lot of fun, and I finally understand the whole "the cake is a lie" meme, lol. I really enjoy the dark humor in both Portal and Portal 2, and the gameplay is way more enjoyable than I was expecting. I think these games have aged very well. It's definitely worth checking them both out, in my opinion, especially if there's a good deal going on.
